Definition: For use in representing suspected condition of public health concerns from provider to public (population) health departments.
unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
Comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
Slicing Description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

Definition: Identifiers assigned to this event performer or other systems.
Requirements: Allows identification of the event as it is known by various participating systems and in a way that remains consistent across servers.

Definition: A protocol, guideline, orderset or other definition that was adhered to in whole or in part by this event.
Comments: [The allowed reference resources may be adjusted as appropriate for the event resource].

Definition: A larger event of which this particular event is a component or step.
Comments: Not to be used to link an event to an Encounter - use Event.context for that.
Requirements: E.g. Drug administration as part of a procedure, procedure as part of observation, etc.

Short: in-progress | suspended | aborted | completed | entered-in-error | unknown
Definition: The current state of the event.
Comments: A nominal state-transition diagram can be found in the [[event.html#statemachine | Event pattern]] documentationUnknown does not represent "other" - one of the defined statuses must apply.  Unknown is used when the authoring system is not sure what the current status is.
Binding Description: Codes identifying the stage lifecycle stage of the case

Definition: A code that classifies the kind of case  this is.clinical discipline, department or diagnostic service that created the  (e.g. infectious disease, poisoning). This is used for searching, sorting and display purposes.
Binding Description: Codes indicating what triggered this case.  Based upon Lab Order Code, Lab Result Code, Lab Results and Diagnosis.

Definition: Reportable condition codes that caused this case to be generated.
Binding Description: Codes indicating what triggered this case report.  Based upon Lab Order Code, Lab Result Code, Lab Results and Diagnosis.

Definition: The individual or set of individuals the case  is about.
Comments: [For resources that aren't patient-specific, the set of allowed resources may be extended to include other things.  Group should generally be retained unless there's certainty this resource won't be used for veterinary, research or public health settings where Group may be necessary (e.g. this cage of rats/crate of chickens, group of people in a 5 mile radious of the incident, etc.)].
Requirements: Links the event to the Patient context.
Mapping: Logical Mapping: PAT in proximity to EVN segment

Definition: The encounter or episode of care that establishes the context for this event.
Comments: This will typically be the encounter the event occurred within, but some events may be initiated prior to or after the official completion of an encounter or episode but still be tied to the context of the encounter or episode (e.g. pre-admission lab tests).
Requirements: Links the request to the Encounter context.
Mapping: Logical Mapping: PV1 in proximity to EVN segment

Short: Clinically relevant time/time-period for the case
Definition: The Period of time over which this case is considered active.
Comments: [The list of types may be constrained as appropriate for the type of event].

Definition: The Provider responsible for the Case Investigation.  E.g., The Napa County Public Health Division.
Comments: [Resources may choose to replace this with just a single performer or repeating where there's no need to distinguish role and/or responsible organization].

Definition: The Provider or Organization responsible for Patient's care.  This is usually the same as who initiated and sent the intitial case data as well.
The location where the case originated.
The patient's occupation.
Requirements: Identification of potential risk,  transmission risk.
Binding Description: US Department of Labor Bureau of Labor Statitics Occupational Group Codes

Definition: The patient's occupation.
Requirements: Identification of potential risk,  transmission risk.

Definition: The patient's travel history including dates and location.
Requirements: Risk, potential severity of action,  timeliness of action (e.g. is travel  history relevant); Prioritization and triaging.

Definition: The period during which the patient's traveled.
Where the patient traveled to as a coded concept or free text.
Binding Description: Where the patient traveled to as a coded concept. This value set is based upon ISO 3166 (Countries) as well as FIPS 5-2 (States).

Definition: Where the patient traveled to as an address.
Ordered tests for the patient during the encounter.
Ordered tests for the patient during the encounter.
This order triggered this case to be intitiated.

Specific text, code or reference for finding or diagnosis, which may include ruled-out or resolved conditions, history, signs and symptoms, diagnostic information and provider interpretations and diagnoses.
Requirements: Indicators of reportable condition -Important descriptors of condition/ epidemiologic information that support epidemiologic investigation.
Constraint(s): Lab Result, Symptoms, Diagnosis, HPI, Reason for Visit

Definition: Coded diagnosis or symptoms or other findiings relevant to the case.
Binding Description: Codes identifying the findings for this case
Constraint(s): Lab Result, Symptoms, Diagnosis, HPI, Reason for VisitLab Result, Symptoms, Diagnosis, HPI, Reason for Visit

Definition: Resource references for patient findings that are relevnat to the case. For finding and diagnosis in  free text only format use the `.text` element.
Constraint(s): Lab Result, Symptoms, Diagnosis, HPI, Reason for VisitLab Result, Symptoms, Diagnosis, HPI, Reason for Visit

Definition: This finding triggered this case  to be generated.
Treatments for the reportable event.
Requirements: To find treatments that were  prescribed; prophylaxis; knowing if the  patient has already been treated, lower  on the list for PH (priority).

Definition: Comments made about the event by the performer, subject or other participants.
